comments.body: One more thing (I hope that's my last nitpick!)... I'm not convinced that `--merge` option should really be used for this purpose, it's meaning is pretty unclear in this context :/ how about extracting e.g. `--no-detect-squash-merges` option for both `status` and `traverse` instead?

Roger. Would you mind taking the conn on these changes in your branch and just merging from there?

I'm agnostic to the option name and documentation decisions with the skeleton of this feature in place:

* `squash` and `rebase` is detected via tree-equivalence in the "default" `git machete` mode.
* There is an escape flag to fall back to the standard merge-based detection.
Ok! so I'm approving this branch, I'll take care of the remaining comments on my subsequent PR

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@    local slide_out_opts="-d --down-fork-point= -M --merge -n --no-edit-merge --no-interactive-rebase"
    local squash_opts="-f --fork-point="
    local status_opts="--color= -L --list-commits-with-hashes -l --list-commits -M --merge"
    local traverse_opts="-F --fetch -l --list-commits -M --merge -n --no-edit-merge --no-interactive-rebase --return-to= --start-from= -w --whole -W -y --yes"
    local update_opts="-f --fork-point= -M --merge -n --no-edit-merge --no-interactive-rebase"

@@ -1,1 +6,14 @@  local categories="addable managed slidable slidable-after unmanaged with-overridden-fork-point"
  local directions="down first last next prev root up"
  local opt_color_args="always auto never"
  local opt_return_to_args="here nearest-remaining stay"
  local opt_start_from_args="here root first-root"

  local common_opts="--debug -h --help -v --verbose --version"
  local add_opts="-o --onto= -R --as-root -y --yes"
  local advance_opts="-y --yes"
